titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1036) to amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide that such Act does not preempt certain State laws.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-335, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1036 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Bill is open to amendments. After general debate the bill shall be considered for amendment under the five-minute rule for a period not to exceed four hours.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 113.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/8/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1036 (amending the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide that it does not preempt certain State laws).
